intro: Caperonia altissima, commonly known as the tall caper, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its erect growth habit, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, and its clusters of small, white to pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Caperonia altissima is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
